lead.en: a PhD student in Computer Graphics and Interaction at DGP lab at the University of Toronto. I am advised by Karan Singh.

about.en:
I am broadly interested in utilizing interactions in 3D space for design, modelling and fabrication applications. I'm also interested in the full sketch-based/curve-based design pipeline, starting from acquisition, to processing, and finally to surfacing or fabrication.

Before my 14-hour economy class journey to the University of Toronto, I did my masters and undergrad in Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Kanpur in India. For my masters thesis, I worked with Adrien Bousseau and Vinay P. Namboodiri on shape and view interpolation of design sketches.
